question.text: Itâ€™s dry but very windy. On the motorway, you see a car towing a large caravan in the middle lane. You then move onto a long open stretch of single carriageway, where you pass a motorcyclist. Later, you are travelling behind a long vehicle and want to overtake. Once in town, there are trams directed by traffic light signals and you have to drive across their tracks. Further on, a bus is signalling its intention to pull out from a bus stop.
question.part: Why is it important not to obstruct these tracks?

answer.text: Electric power to the tram may be disrupted
The wheels of your vehicle could get stuck
Your tyre treads could be seriously damaged
Trams are unable to steer round obstructions
